ncsd_output_reader.py¶

Contains function which reads data from ncsd output files. Also contains a couple small functions for getting names of nuclei.

ncsd_python.plot_modules.ncsd_output_reader.element_name(Z)¶

Gets the name of an element, e.g. element_name(1) = “H”.

ncsd_python.plot_modules.ncsd_output_reader.nucleus_name(Z, N)¶

Returns the name of a nucleus in ‘Li8’ style

ncsd_python.plot_modules.ncsd_output_reader.read_all_ncsd_output(real_paths)¶

Runs read_ncsd_output for many paths in case you have a few different files, tries to merge data at the end.

ncsd_python.plot_modules.ncsd_output_reader.read_ncsd_output(filename)¶

Parses ncsd output.

Eventually returns a dict of the form:

dict = {
    "element_name": "B",
    "nucleus_name": "B11",
    "Z": 5,
    "N": 6,
    "Z_plus_N": 11,
    "n_states": 10,
    "filename": "filename",
    "interaction_name": "n3lo-NN3Nlnl-srg2.0"
    "calculated_spectrum": {
        Nmax: {
            state_num: [
                J(angular momentum),
                Repetition,
                Parity,
                Energy
            ],
        }
    }
}
